hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Pairs Mean Reversion on 2.5 Std Dev Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: When the BTC/ETH price ratio diverges by more than 2.5 standard deviations from its 30-day rolling mean, the ratio will revert to the mean within 5 trading days with 70% probability in NEUTRAL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH maintain long-term equilibrium as dominant crypto assets. In neutral regimes without strong directional bias, institutional rebalancing and arbitrage flows correct extreme divergences. The 2.5σ threshold filters noise while capturing meaningful dislocations.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH ratio > 30-day mean + 2.5 * 30-day std dev (go long ETH/short BTC)
BTC/ETH ratio < 30-day mean - 2.5 * 30-day std dev (go long BTC/short ETH)
Market regime = NEUTRAL (VIX < 25, crypto vol index < 80)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Ratio returns to within 0.5 std dev of mean
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Divergence extends to 3.5 std dev from mean

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of trades hit stop-loss before take-profit over 50+ occurrences, or mean reversion time exceeds 5 days in >40% of cases.
